instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no display, no bklight but it has chime
threads.message:
[LIST]
[*]hi everybody, after long time back to work. This is water damage ,<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>., <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Turn on but no image no bklight but chime.

	ppvout-s0=0v
	<SIGNAL>PP5VR3V3_SW</SIGNAL>-lcd= 0v
	connector pin 28,29,30= 0v and pin5 =0v
	bklt-en=0v
	smc-lid =3.4v
	scl=.458 and sda=.468 diode mode.
	<CHIP>U8330</CHIP>: PIN1=0V, P2,5=0V,P3=0V,P6=0V,P7=0V,P8=3.3V
	<CHIP>U8340</CHIP>: P4=0V

	now i am stuck, i checked with good known screen same model. no luck.
[/LIST]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no display, no bklight but it has chime
threads.message:
Where was the liquid spill?

"connector pin 28,29,30= 0v and pin5 =0v"
You must get 5V at least in the first seconds, when power on the board.

"Turn on but no image no bklight but chime."
Look if has USB acivity; board could get stuck after chime...
Did you check external video?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no display, no bklight but it has chime
threads.message:
This is water damage everywhere.
at least in the first seconds, when power on the board= 0v
No USB Activity, no external also.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no display, no bklight but it has chime
threads.message:
Pufff, you must clean the board and rebuild corroded traces, change affected resistors/capacitors.
You may consider trash it; could be wasting time...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no display, no bklight but it has chime
threads.message:
After 10 minutes ultrasonic and 8 hours dry up, found 
video connector pin 3&4= 5.1v, p1=0v,  p5=3.3v but after 5 seconds it drop 0 v.
Found water damage around <CHIP>U8300</CHIP>, and pin1=5v, p2=0v, p4= 5v, p6=0v and p7=0v.

Please help me what it could be the problem. Thanks in advance.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no display, no bklight but it has chime
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no display, no bklight but it has chime
threads.message:
Thanks.
<CHIP>U8330</CHIP>: P1=0V, P2,5=0V,P3=0V, P6=0V,P7=0V,   P8=3.3V.

<CHIP>U8340</CHIP>: P4=0V, P5=3.3V, P1=0V.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no display, no bklight but it has chime
threads.message:
"p5=3.3v but after 5 seconds it drop 0 v."
It comes from <CHIP>U8310</CHIP>; this means you have <SIGNAL>EDP_PANEL_PWR_OR_PSR_EN</SIGNAL> present in that moment.
This signal comes from <CHIP>U8330</CHIP>!
So check <CHIP>U8300</CHIP>/30/40 voltages in these 5 seconds...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no display, no bklight but it has chime
threads.message:
check <CHIP>U8300</CHIP>/30/40 voltages in these 5 seconds...as following
<CHIP>U8300</CHIP>:
1=  5 then drop 3v , 2=   3.2 v drop 0v  , 4=5v stable. ,6=  0v   , 7= 0v    ,

<CHIP>U8330</CHIP>: P1=0V, P2,5=0V,P3=3.3v & drop 0V, P6=3.3v & drop 0V, P7=0V,  P8=3.3V. 

<CHIP>U8340</CHIP>: P4=0V, P5=3.3V, P1=0V.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no display, no bklight but it has chime
threads.message:
I don't see pins 4 & 6 on <CHIP>U8300</CHIP>; which schematic use you?
Please provide accurate information...

Pins 1 & 4 of <CHIP>U8340</CHIP> should go high in these 5s; if not panel is not recognized.
Try another compatible LCD assembly.
But need correct readings from <CHIP>U8300</CHIP> first.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no display, no bklight but it has chime
threads.message:
this was schematics error, the right one is as following:
<CHIP>U8300</CHIP>:

P3=5V 
P5=0V

 <CHIP>U8340</CHIP>:  p1= 0v and p4=0v tried good known lcd.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no display, no bklight but it has chime
threads.message:
Change <CHIP>U8300</CHIP>.
Check first no short on pin 5; with LCD connected...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no display, no bklight but it has chime
threads.message: changed <CHIP>U8300</CHIP> , now got 5V and unit show me the display.Thanks a lot 2informaticos.
